page.title: 01A General View of Wombourne
page.content: Six miles to the south of Wolverhampton in attractive open countryside are the villages of Wombourne,Himley & Smestow. Himley & Smestow are ribbon settlements with few houses. Wombourne, with about 15000 villagers, is the central feature of this area.It has its origins in Pre- Norman times with its name coming from two Anglo-Saxon words meaning "winding stream". Wombourne is centred on a village green,now a sports ground,surrounded by local shops,the ancient church, library and civic and community centres. In recent years there have been many housing developments, both council and private, as well as the provision of several small industrial estates. The land is undulating with Orton Ridge to the north of the village offering the only real high ground.Most of the surrounding area is farmland.
